required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Evaluation of Visual Acuity and Patient Satisfaction With AT LISA TRI 839MP Intraocular Lenses

oversight_info.authority: France: Afssaps - Agence française de sécurité sanitaire des produits de santé (Saint-Denis)
United Kingdom: National Institute for Health Research

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of the study is to evaluate the far, intermediate and near visual acuities with a trifocal IOL.

detailed_description.textblock:
After bilateral cataract surgery, monocular and binocular uncorrected (UCVA) and best distance corrected visual acuity (BCVA) will be measured at far (4m), intermediate (80 cm) and near (40 cm) distance as well as the subjective refraction.
A patient questionnaire will be used to assess the patient satisfaction and spectacle independence.

clinical_study.study_design: Endpoint Classification: Safety/Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Single Group Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Treatment

primary_outcome.description: Monocular and binocular uncorrected and best distance corrected

secondary_outcome.description: Monocular and binocular uncorrected and best distance corrected

arm_group.arm_group_label: implantation of a trifocal IOL (AT LISA tri 839MP)

intervention.arm_group_label: implantation of a trifocal IOL (AT LISA tri 839MP)

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Man or woman, over 50 years of age
- Bilateral implantation of a trifocal intraocular lens
- Capsular bag implantation
Exclusion Criteria:
- Existing ocular pathology
- Surgical complications
- Corneal astigmatism ≥ 1.0D
